title: 7 Easy Ways to Change or Create Desktop Icons on Windows

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen, or press the Windows key. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you want to use a custom icon from the internet, see the downloading icons section first.

steps.title: Click Settings .
steps.content: Click Settings . It's in the lower-left side of the Start window.

steps.title: Click Personalization.
steps.content: Click Personalization . This is the monitor-shaped icon on the Windows Settings page. You can also access this page by right-clicking a blank space on the desktop and then clicking Personalization in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Themes.
steps.content: Click Themes . It's a tab on the left side of the Personalization window.

steps.title: Click Desktop icon settings.
steps.content: Click Desktop icon settings . This link is in the upper-right side of the Themes page. Clicking it opens the Desktop Icon Settings window. If you haven't edited your theme at all, this link will be in the middle of the page beneath the "Related Settings" heading. You can also click Get more themes in the Store below the "Apply a theme" heading to browse desktop themes. Some themes will change your desktop icons' appearances.

steps.title: Click an icon you want to change.
steps.content: Click an icon you want to change. This will select the icon. For example, you might click This PC , Recycle Bin , Network , or User's Files . You can also check the box next to a desktop icon's name at the top of the window to make it appear on your desktop, or uncheck the box to remove it from the desktop. Check the "Allow themes to change desktop icons" box on this window to enable theme-related icon changes.

steps.title: Click Change Icon.
steps.content: Click Change Icon . It's near the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Select an icon.
steps.content: Select an icon. You can select two different types of icons: System icon : Click an icon in the window. Custom icon : Click Browse , then click the folder that your custom icons are in on the left side of the window. Select the icon you want to use, then click Open .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will assign your selected icon to the desktop program.

steps.title: Click Apply, then click OK.
steps.content: Click Apply , then click OK . Doing so confirms your decision and changes the desktop program's icon to your selected icon.

steps.title: Open the File Explorer .
steps.content: Open the File Explorer . You can find this icon at the lower-left side of your taskbar, or you can press the Start menu and search for File Explorer . You cannot change the icons of specific files (e.g., Notepad files or .exe files) using this method. You'll only be able to customize desktop shortcuts and folders with this method.

steps.title: Click Desktop.
steps.content: Click Desktop . It's a folder in the left-hand column of options in the File Explorer window. This may already be pinned under Quick access .

steps.title: Click a shortcut or folder icon.
steps.content: Click a shortcut or folder icon. Shortcut icons have a white box with an arrow in their lower-left corners.

steps.title: Click the Home tab.
steps.content: Click the Home tab. It's in the upper-left corner of the File Explorer window. Doing so will open a toolbar at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click Properties.
steps.content: Click Properties . This is a white box with a red checkmark in the "Open" section of the toolbar. If you click the down-arrow instead of the Properties icon, you'll need to click Properties again. You can also right-click on the icon on your desktop and then click Properties to get to this menu. If the icon is pinned to your taskbar, you can right-click it and click Properties to get this menu.

steps.title: Click Customize or Shortcut.
steps.content: Click Customize or Shortcut . This will be located at the top of the Properties window. Shortcut : Click the Shortcut tab at the top of the Properties window. Folder : Click the Customize tab at the top of the Properties window.

steps.title: Click Change Icon.
steps.content: Click Change Icon . This will be near the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Select an icon.
steps.content: Select an icon. You can select two different types of icons: System icon - Click an icon in the window. Custom icon - Click Browse , then click the folder that your custom icons are in on the left side of the window. Select the icon you want to use, then click Open .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will assign your selected icon.

steps.title: Click Apply, then click OK.
steps.content: Click Apply , then click OK . Doing so confirms your decision and changes the original icon to your selected icon.

steps.title: Right-click your desktop.
steps.content: Right-click your desktop. For easier navigation, be sure to minimize all open windows . [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source A pop-up menu will open. Use this method if you want to toggle icon visibility on your desktop.

steps.title: Hover your cursor over "View".
steps.content: Hover your cursor over "View". This will be at the very top of the menu.

steps.title: Click Show desktop icons.
steps.content: Click Show desktop icons . When this option in unchecked, all desktop icons will be hidden. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To show desktop icons again, click Show desktop icons .

steps.title: Right-click your desktop.
steps.content: Right-click your desktop. For easier navigation, be sure to minimize all open windows. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Hover your cursor over "View".
steps.content: Hover your cursor over "View". This will be at the very top of the menu.

steps.title: Select your icon size.
steps.content: Select your icon size. You can click Large icons , Medium icons , or Small icons . After clicking, your desktop icons will be changed immediately. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You can also hold CTRL and scroll up or down on your mouse to increase or decrease the icon size .

steps.title: Open the File Explorer .
steps.content: Open the File Explorer . You can find this icon at the lower-left side of your taskbar, or you can press the Start menu and search for File Explorer .

steps.title: Click the Desktop folder.
steps.content: Click the Desktop folder. It's on the left side of the File Explorer window. This may already be pinned under Quick access .

steps.title: Click the Home tab.
steps.content: Click the Home tab. You'll find this tab in the upper-left side of the File Explorer window.

steps.title: Click New item.
steps.content: Click New item . It's in the "New" section of the tool bar at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click Shortcut.
steps.content: Click Shortcut . This option is in the New item drop-down menu. A window with options for your new shortcut will appear. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Browse.
steps.content: Click Browse . It's in the middle of the page. Doing so opens a pop-up window. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Scroll down and click the program's or file's folder.
steps.content: Scroll down and click the program's or file's folder. For example, if the program or file is in the Documents folder, you'd click My Documents . You may have to click through several different folders to find the program or file for which you want to create a shortcut.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Doing so sets the desktop shortcut's target as your selected item. If you rename the desktop icon or move it to a new folder, your shortcut will no longer work.

steps.title: Click Next, then enter a name.
steps.content: Click Next , then enter a name. The default name for the shortcut is the same name as the program itself.

steps.title: Click Finish.
steps.content: Click Finish . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. This will create your shortcut in the folder you selected.

steps.title: Open the Paint application on your computer.
steps.content: Open the Paint application on your computer. If you don't have the Paint application, you can download it from the Microsoft Store. Use this method if you want to create custom icons .

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . It's a blue button in the upper-left corner of the Paint window.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . This option is in the File menu. Doing so opens a window where you can open a file location. If you'd rather create your own icon by drawing in Paint, skip this step and instead create your drawing .

steps.title: Select a picture.
steps.content: Select a picture. You may have to click a location on the left side of the Open window (e.g., Pictures ) to find the picture you want to open. Skip this step if you're drawing your own icon.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . This will open your image in the Paint window. Skip this step if you're drawing your own icon.

steps.title: Click File again.
steps.content: Click File again. It's in the top-left corner of Paint.

steps.title: Select Save as.
steps.content: Select Save as . This option is near the top of the File menu.

steps.title: Click BMP picture.
steps.content: Click BMP picture . It's an option to the right of the Save as button. Doing so opens a Save As window where you can name your file.

steps.title: Type in your file's name followed by .ico.
steps.content: Type in your file's name followed by .ico . This will ensure that your file is saved as an icon file. For example, you might name your file "shortcut.ico".

steps.title: Navigate to a save location.
steps.content: Navigate to a save location. Do so in the left-hand pane of the Save As window. The Pictures folder is a safe place to save your shortcut file.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's at the bottom of the window. Doing so will save your icon in your selected folder.

steps.title: Change a program's icon
steps.content: Change a program's icon using your created icon. You'll use the Browse method and select your custom icon from the folder where you saved it.

steps.title: Open a web browser.
steps.content: Open a web browser. Microsoft Edge is the official Windows 10 browser, though you can use Google Chrome, Firefox, Opera, or another browser.

steps.title: Search for Windows icons.
steps.content: Search for Windows icons. Type "download windows desktop icons" into your browser's address bar or a search engine and press Enter . You can narrow your search by entering the program's name (e.g., "Windows my computer icon") or by using the icon file type (e.g., "ICO"). Some popular icon websites include: https://www.flaticon.com/ https://feathericons.com/ https://fontawesome.com/ https://boxicons.com/

steps.title: Download the icons you want.
steps.content: Download the icons you want. You can do this by opening a site that has your icons and clicking the Download button. Doing so will save the icons to your computer. If you download multiple icons at once, you may have to extract the icons to a regular folder before continuing.

steps.title: Open the File Explorer .
steps.content: Open the File Explorer . You can find this icon at the lower-left side of your taskbar, or you can press the Start menu and search for File Explorer .

steps.title: Click Desktop.
steps.content: Click Desktop . This folder is on the left side of File Explorer.

steps.title: Click your icons folder.
steps.content: Click your icons folder. Doing so selects it. If you just downloaded one icon, select the icon instead.

steps.title: Click Home.
steps.content: Click Home . This tab is in the upper-left corner of the File Explorer window.

steps.title: Click Move to.
steps.content: Click Move to . It's in the "Organize" section of the toolbar at the top of the File Explorer window.

steps.title: Click Pictures.
steps.content: Click Pictures . This folder is near the middle of the pop-up window. You can select any folder on your computer if you don't want to place your icons in Pictures .

steps.title: Click Move.
steps.content: Click Move . This will send your icons to a folder where you won't move or delete them.

steps.title: Change a program's icon
steps.content: Change a program's icon using your downloaded icon. You'll use the Browse method and then select an icon from within the Pictures folder to do this.
